intro: Weigeltia grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered weigelt, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green during the growing season. Weigeltia grandifolia thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
